body:
- `nvim --version`: commit 19646a2985e54dfc561a90a70054522afc052a45 on git master
- Vim (version: ) behaves differently?
- Operating system/version: Mageia v6 x86-64
- Terminal name/version: either konsole with tmux or xterm without it
- `$TERM`: screen

### Actual behaviour
"make test" fails with:

```
●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●-- Output to stderr:               [14/1992]

on 'executor'

tion 'safe'
```

Thanks!

comment_data.body: would you mind trying #6539 (where a similar error was exposed and fixed)  ? Also change `utfTerminal` to `nvim` in `CMakeLists.txt` line 436 to see which test failed.

libmpack seem to have trouble with large redraw data. This confirms it can also happen on linux. I would guess the bug in libmpack itself is platform-independent, but  there is system-dependent timing sensitivity in the test or pipe buffer size that matters if the data it can't handle is seen or not.
@tarruda What are your thoughts on this?

> libmpack seem to have trouble with large redraw data.

This should be possible to reproduce by recording every message sent from nvim in a file and passing it in a single call to libmpack.

I could be missing something, but the `invalid msgpack string` should only happen when unpacking if `\xc1` is read as the type code in the input stream(every other byte is a valid type code) so I guess this means memory corruption somewhere. Could be in libmpack, libmpack-lua or some other C code in the client.

Hi all!

Now I am getting this hang during "make test" on my system:

```
[ RUN      ] getcwd() fails on -1 if previous arg is >=0: 5.33 ms OK

[ RUN      ] haslocaldir() fails on list: 14.99 ms OK
[ RUN      ] haslocaldir() fails on dictionary: 11.32 ms OK
[ RUN      ] haslocaldir() fails on funcref: 12.18 ms OK
[ RUN      ] haslocaldir() fails on number less than -1: 7.52 ms OK
[ RUN      ] haslocaldir() fails on -1 if previous arg is >=0: 4.29 ms OK
[ RUN      ] haslocaldir() fails to parse more than one argument: 11.18 ms OK
[ RUN      ] getcwd() returns empty string if working directory does not exist:
2.82 ms OK
[----------] 31 tests from /home/shlomif/Download/unpack/file/vim/neovim/test/functional/ex_cmds/cd_spec.lua (987.87 ms total)

[----------] Running tests from /home/shlomif/Download/unpack/file/vim/neovim/test/functional/ex_cmds/ctrl_c_spec.lua
[ RUN      ] CTRL-C (mapped) interrupts :global:         

```

How can we fix it?

```

⇒ On branch master
?? .nvimlog
?? Xtest-tmpdir/
?? Xtest_xdg/

origin  git@github.com:shlomif/neovim.git (fetch)
origin  git@github.com:shlomif/neovim.git (push)
upstream        https://github.com/neovim/neovim.git (fetch)
upstream        ssh://git@github.com/neovim/neovim.git (push)
shlomif@telaviv1:~/Download/unpack/file/vim/neovim$ git show | head -5commit 4dee942e732d41ad62b732c0a39719d9405bc928
Author: Andy Russell <arussell123@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Jul 15 14:51:51 2017 -0400

    provider/clipboard.vim: capture/display errors (#6684)
shlomif@telaviv1:~/Download/unpack/file/vim/neovim$

```

@shlomif That's the same issue, no? If it's hung, please get a gdb backtrace (`thread apply all bt full`, see the Development-tips page on the wiki). If it's crashed, we need to capture the data being passed to libmpack as mentioned in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/6562#issuecomment-297370058 . 

Try building with log level=0 (debug):

    rm -rf build && make CMAKE_EXTRA_FLAGS="-DMIN_LOG_LEVEL=0"

then run _only_ the `CTRL-C` test:

    TEST_FILE=test/functional/ex_cmds/ctrl_c_spec.lua make functionaltest

Please reply to list if it's a mailing list post - http://shlom.in/reply .

`ctrl_c_spec.lua` fails on some systems (could be a bug in libmpack, lua, the nvim lua-client, or nvim's own I/O layer: we haven't narrowed it down). Try this:

    TEST_SKIP_FRAGILE=1 make test

Thanks @justinmk ! With `LC_ALL=C` and the fragile flag all tests are passing here.

Nothing actionable here, though if the issue still occurs that would be good to know.

There were many improvements (fixes to race conditions, channel logic ordering, etc) that have eliminated most occurrences of `invalid msgpack-rpc string`.

Related: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/8102

labels.description: building and installing Neovim using the provided scripts
labels.name: build

milestone.description: Low priority items. We plan to work on this but don't have a target date.
milestone.title: backlog

title: test: ctrl_c_spec fails on some systems
